The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life. [NCIT: C79532]

efotraits.label: systemic scleroderma
efotraits.description: A chronic disorder, possibly autoimmune, marked by excessive production of collagen which results in hardening and thickening of body tissues. The two types of systemic scleroderma, limited cutaneous and diffuse cutaneous are classified with focus on the extent of affected skin. A relationship exists between the extent of skin area affected and degree of internal organ/system involvement. Systemic scleroderma can manifest itself in pulmonary fibrosis, Raynaud's syndrome, digestive system telangiectasias, renal hypertension and/or pulmonary hypertension. [NCIT: C72070]

efotraits.label: type 1 diabetes mellitus
efotraits.description: A chronic condition characterized by minimal or absent production of insulin by the pancreas. [NCIT: C2986]

efotraits.label: Crohn's disease
efotraits.description: A gastrointestinal disorder characterized by chronic inflammation involving all layers of the intestinal wall, noncaseating granulomas affecting the intestinal wall and regional lymph nodes, and transmural fibrosis. Crohn disease most commonly involves the terminal ileum; the colon is the second most common site of involvement. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: appendicitis
efotraits.description: Acute inflammation of the vermiform appendix. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: multiple sclerosis
efotraits.description: A progressive autoimmune disorder affecting the central nervous system resulting in demyelination. Patients develop physical and cognitive impairments that correspond with the affected nerve fibers. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: enthesitis-related juvenile idiopathic arthritis
efotraits.description: Enthesitis-related juvenile idiopathic arthritis is a subtype of juvenile idiopathic arthritis that is characterized by both arthritis and inflammation of an enthesitis site (the point at which a ligament, tendon, or joint capsule attaches to the bone). Signs and symptoms generally develop in late childhood or early adolescence and include pain, tenderness, and swelling in joints and at the enthesis. The knee and the back of the ankle (at the Achilles tendon) are the most commonly affected parts of the body. The underlying cause of enthesitis-related juvenile idiopathic arthritis is currently unknown (idiopathic). It is very rare for more than one member of a family to have juvenile arthritis; however, research suggests that having a family member with juvenile arthritis or any autoimmune disease may increase the risk of having juvenile arthritis, in general. Treatment usually involves different types of medications to help manage symptoms and/or physical therapy.

efotraits.label: psoriasis
efotraits.description: An autoimmune condition characterized by red, well-delineated plaques with silvery scales that are usually on the extensor surfaces and scalp. They can occasionally present with these manifestations: pustules; erythema and scaling in intertriginous areas, and erythroderma, that are often distributed on extensor surfaces and scalp. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: seasonal allergic rhinitis
efotraits.description: Allergic rhinitis caused by outdoor allergens. [NCIT: C92188]

efotraits.label: multiple myeloma
efotraits.description: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia. Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) [NCIT: C3242]

efotraits.label: marginal zone B-cell lymphoma
efotraits.description: A usually indolent mature B-cell lymphoma, arising from the marginal zone of lymphoid tissues. It is characterized by the presence of small to medium sized atypical lymphocytes. It comprises three entities, according to the anatomic sites involved: extranodal marginal zone B-cell lymphoma of mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue, which affects extranodal sites (most often stomach, lung, skin, and ocular adnexa); nodal marginal zone B-cell lymphoma, which affects lymph nodes without evidence of extranodal disease; and splenic marginal zone B-cell lymphoma, which affects the spleen and splenic hilar lymph nodes, bone marrow, and often the peripheral blood. [NCIT: C4341]

efotraits.label: basophil percentage of leukocytes
efotraits.description: A calculated measurement in which the number of basophil granulocytes is divided by the number of all white blood cells in a specified sample of peripheral venous blood, and the result presented as a ratio, fraction, quotient or percentage. A basophil is a granular leukocyte with an irregularly shaped, relatively pale-staining nucleus that is partially constricted into two lobes, and with cytoplasm containing coarse granules of variable size that stain bluish-black when exposed to basic dyes.

efotraits.label: C-reactive protein measurement
efotraits.description: C-reactive protein (CRP) measurement is a measurement of the level of C-reactive protein in the blood.  Levels are known to rise in response to inflammation, CRP is therefore used as a clinical measure of inflammation. The measurement is used in the process of clinical diagnosis as high levels of CRP are associated with cardiovascular disease, diabetes and hypertension and in some cancers. | is about MeSH:D002097

efotraits.label: basophil count
efotraits.description: The number of granulocytes (polymorphonuclear leukocytes) in a specified volume of blood, usually 1 cubic millimeter. | quantification of basophils in the blood

efotraits.label: apolipoprotein A 1 measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of apolipoprotein A 1 in a sample. It is encoded in humans by the APOA1 gene and is the major protein component of high density lipoprotein (HDL) in plasma. Apolipoprotein A 1 relates to lower observational risk of coronary artery disease.

efotraits.label: testosterone measurement
efotraits.description:
is a quantification of testosterone, typically in serum. Testosterone is a steroid hormone.Testosterone measurement is used in the diagnosis of
precocious or delayed puberty, infertility (in men and women), ovarian tumours, adrenal tumours and pituitary disorders.

efotraits.label: non-high density lipoprotein cholesterol measurement
efotraits.description: The quantification of NHDL cholesterol in blood, calculated by subtracting the amount of cholesterol in the HDL fraction from total cholesterol and used as an indicator for cardiovascular disease risk

efotraits.label: apolipoprotein A-IV measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of serum lipoprotein A-IV. Apolipoprotein A-IV, encoded in humans by the APOA4 gene,  a 376-residue mature O-linked glycoprotein.

efotraits.label: total cholesterol measurement
efotraits.description: A total cholesterol measurement is the quantification of cholesterol in blood, total cholesterol is defined as the sum of HDL, LDL, and VLDL.

efotraits.label: triglyceride measurement
efotraits.description: A triglyceride  measurement is a quantification of triglycerides in some body fluid, used as a biomarker for cardiovascular disease.

efotraits.label: polyunsaturated fatty acid measurement
efotraits.description: The determination of the amount of polyunsaturated fatty acids present in a sample.

efotraits.label: low density lipoprotein cholesterol measurement
efotraits.description: The measurement of LDL cholesterol in blood used as a risk indicator for heart disease.

efotraits.label: vitamin D measurement
efotraits.description:
A quantification of Vitamin D levels, typically in blood. Vitamin D includes both CHOLECALCIFEROLS and ERGOCALCIFEROLS, which have the common effect of preventing or curing RICKETS in animals. It can also be viewed as a hormone since it can be formed in SKIN by action of ULTRAVIOLET RAYS upon the precursors, 7-dehydrocholesterol and ERGOSTEROL, and acts on VITAMIN D RECEPTORS to regulate CALCIUM in opposition to PARATHYROID HORMONE (MeSH).
25-hydroxyvitamin D or calcifediol, a prehormone precursor of vitamin D, is widely used as a proxy to quanitfy vitamin D levels in blood. | is about MeSH:D014807

efotraits.label: high density lipoprotein cholesterol measurement
efotraits.description: The measurement of HDL cholesterol in blood used as a risk indicator for heart disease.

efotraits.label: apolipoprotein B measurement
efotraits.description: The measurement of ApoB in blood. Apolipoprotein B is a major protein constituent of chylomicrons (apo B-48), LDL (apo B-100) and VLDL (apo B-100). Apo B-100 functions as a recognition signal for the cellular binding and internalization of LDL particles by the apoB/E receptor, and is upregulated in response to enterovirus 71.

efotraits.label: apolipoprotein A 1 measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of apolipoprotein A 1 in a sample. It is encoded in humans by the APOA1 gene and is the major protein component of high density lipoprotein (HDL) in plasma. Apolipoprotein A 1 relates to lower observational risk of coronary artery disease.

efotraits.label: lipoprotein A measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some lipoprotein A in a sample

efotraits.label: metabolic syndrome
efotraits.description: A cluster of metabolic risk factors for CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASES and TYPE 2 DIABETES MELLITUS. The major components of metabolic syndrome X include excess ABDOMINAL FAT; atherogenic DYSLIPIDEMIA; HYPERTENSION; HYPERGLYCEMIA; INSULIN RESISTANCE; a proinflammatory state; and a prothrombotic (THROMBOSIS) state. (from AHA/NHLBI/ADA Conference Proceedings, Circulation 2004; 109:551-556)

efotraits.label: obesity
efotraits.description: A disorder involving an excessive amount of body fat.

efotraits.label: eating disorder
efotraits.description: A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake. [NCIT: C89332]

efotraits.label: mineral metabolism disease
efotraits.description: Abnormal levels of minerals in the blood.

efotraits.label: gestational diabetes
efotraits.description: Carbohydrate intolerance first diagnosed during pregnancy. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: iron metabolism disease
efotraits.description: Disorders in the processing of iron in the body: its absorption, transport, storage, and utilization. [MESH: D019189]

efotraits.label: overnutrition
efotraits.description: An imbalanced nutritional status resulting from excessive intake of nutrients. Generally, overnutrition generates an energy imbalance between food consumption and energy expenditure leading to disorders such as obesity. [MESH: D044343]

efotraits.label: type 2 diabetes mellitus
efotraits.description: A type of diabetes mellitus that is characterized by insulin resistance or desensitization and increased blood glucose levels. This is a chronic disease that can develop gradually over the life of a patient and can be linked to both environmental factors and heredity. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: vitamin B12 deficiency
efotraits.description: A disease characterized by low serum levels of vitamin B12, either inherited or acquired. [PMID: 16846473]

efotraits.label: metabolic disease
efotraits.description: A congenital disorder (due to inherited enzyme abnormality) or acquired (due to failure of a metabolically important organ) disorder resulting from an abnormal metabolic process. [NCIT: C3235]

efotraits.label: diabetes mellitus
efotraits.description: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: gout
efotraits.description: A condition characterized by painful swelling of the joints, which is caused by deposition of urate crystals. [NCIT: C34650]

efotraits.label: type 1 diabetes mellitus
efotraits.description: A chronic condition characterized by minimal or absent production of insulin by the pancreas. [NCIT: C2986]

efotraits.label: porphyrin metabolism disease
efotraits.description: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of porphyrin-containing compound metabolic process. [MONDO: patterns/basis_in_disruption_of_process]

efotraits.label: diabetic retinopathy
efotraits.description: A chronic, pathological complication associated with diabetes mellitus, where retinal damages are incurred due to microaneurysms in the vasculature of the retina, progressively leading to abnormal blood vessel growth, and swelling and leaking of fluid from blood vessels, resulting in vision loss or blindness. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder characterized by a marked pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity that is inconsistent with developmental level and clearly interferes with functioning in at least two settings (e.g. at home and at school). When present, the symptoms of hyperactivity are most often present before the age of 7 years. There are three recognized presentations or subtypes from most to least common: combined type, inattentive/distractible type, hyperactive/impulsive type. [NCIT: C97160]

efotraits.label: dementia
efotraits.description: Loss of intellectual abilities interfering with an individual's social and occupational functions. Causes include Alzheimer's disease, brain injuries, brain tumors, and vascular disorders. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: Headache
efotraits.description: Cephalgia, or pain sensed in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve. [PMID: 15304572]

efotraits.label: deafness
efotraits.description: A partial or complete loss o f hearing in one or both ears; the level of impairment varies from a mild but important loss of sensitivity to a total loss of hearing. | An inherited or acquired condition characterized by a partial or complete loss of hearing in one or both ears. The level of impairment varies from a mild but important loss of sensitivity to a total loss of hearing. | An inherited or acquired condition characterized by the complete loss of the ability to hear from one or both ears.

efotraits.label: hearing loss
efotraits.description: A partial or complete loss of hearing in one or both ears. It is classified as conductive, sensory, or central. [NCIT: C35731]

efotraits.label: brain cancer
efotraits.description: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm affecting the brain. [NCIT: C3568]

efotraits.label: Alzheimer disease
efotraits.description: A progressive, neurodegenerative disease characterized by loss of function and death of nerve cells in several areas of the brain leading to loss of cognitive function such as memory and language. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: schizophrenia
efotraits.description: A major psychotic disorder characterized by abnormalities in the perception or expression of reality. It affects the cognitive and psychomotor functions. Common clinical signs and symptoms include delusions, hallucinations, disorganized thinking, and retreat from reality. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: brain aneurysm
efotraits.description: A congenital or acquired aneurysm within the cranium. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: epilepsy
efotraits.description: A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: retinopathy
efotraits.description: Any disease or disorder of the retina. [NCIT: C62601]

efotraits.label: migraine disorder
efotraits.description: A common, severe type of vascular headache often associated with increased sympathetic activity, resulting in nausea, vomiting, and light sensitivity. [NCIT: C89715]

efotraits.label: age-related hearing impairment
efotraits.description: Bilateral hearing loss caused by progressive degeneration of cochlear structures and central auditory pathways, typically associated with the aging process. [NCIT: C116367]

efotraits.label: sleep apnea
efotraits.description: A disorder characterized by multiple cessations of respirations during sleep that induce partial arousals and interfere with the maintenance of sleep. [MESH: D012891]

efotraits.label: nicotine dependence
efotraits.description: Physical and psychological dependence on nicotine. [NCIT: C54203]

efotraits.label: hearing disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder characterized by the partial or complete loss of the ability to detect sounds due to damage to the ear structures or inability of the brain to properly interpret or process the auditory signals it receives from the anatomic structures of the ear. [NCIT: C3078]

efotraits.label: glioma
efotraits.description: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells). Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas. Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors. Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. [NCIT: C3059]

efotraits.label: Sleep Disorder
efotraits.description: A change from the patient's baseline sleeping pattern, in the hours slept and/or an alteration/dysfunction in the stages of sleep. [NCIT: C3376]

efotraits.label: ocular cancer
efotraits.description: A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the structures of the eye. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: depressive disorder
efotraits.description: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair. [NCIT: C2982]

efotraits.label: Parkinson disease
efotraits.description: A progressive degenerative disorder of the central nervous system characterized by loss of dopamine producing neurons in the substantia nigra and the presence of Lewy bodies in the substantia nigra and locus coeruleus. Signs and symptoms include tremor which is most pronounced during rest, muscle rigidity, slowing of the voluntary movements, a tendency to fall back, and a mask-like facial expression. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: handedness
efotraits.description: A better, faster, or more precise performance or individual preference for use of a hand, known as the dominant hand; the less capable or less preferred hand is called the non-dominant hand. Dominance typically applies to all tasks, but in rare cases may be task-specific (known as cross-handedness or mixed-dominance) Ambidexterity is the ability to do any task equally well with either hand.

efotraits.label: late-onset Alzheimer's disease
efotraits.description: This is the most common form of the disease, which happens to people age 65 and older. It may or may not run in families. So far, researchers haven’t found a particular gene that causes it. No one knows for sure why some people get it and others don’t.

efotraits.label: narcolepsy
efotraits.description: A sleep disorder characterized by a tendency for excessive sleepiness during the day which occurs even after adequate sleep in the nighttime. The persons who suffer from this condition experience fatigue and may fall asleep at inappropriate times during the day. [NCIT: C84489]

efotraits.label: peripheral nervous system disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the peripheral nervous system.

efotraits.label: retinal break
efotraits.description: Retinal breaks are full-thickness discontinuities in the retina. They can be classified into tears, such as horseshoe tears and giant retinal tears, or holes, such as operculated holes and atrophic holes.

efotraits.label: bipolar II disorder
efotraits.description: A bipolar disorder that is characterized by at least one hypomanic episode and at least one major depressive episode; with this disorder, depressive episodes are more frequent and more intense than manic episodes.

efotraits.label: bipolar disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder of the brain that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks. Often these moods range and shift from periods of elation and energized behavior to those of hopelessness and depression. [NCIT: C34423]

efotraits.label: multiple sclerosis
efotraits.description: A progressive autoimmune disorder affecting the central nervous system resulting in demyelination. Patients develop physical and cognitive impairments that correspond with the affected nerve fibers. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: headache disorder
efotraits.description: Various conditions with the symptom of headache. Headache disorders are classified into major groups, such as primary headache disorders (based on characteristics of their headache symptoms) and secondary headache disorders (based on their etiologies). (International Classification of Headache Disorders, 2nd ed. Cephalalgia 2004: suppl 1) [MESH: D020773]

efotraits.label: anxiety disorder
efotraits.description: A category of psychiatric disorders which are characterized by anxious feelings or fear often accompanied by physical symptoms associated with anxiety. [NCIT: C2878]

efotraits.label: otosclerosis
efotraits.description: Formation of spongy bone in the labyrinth capsule which can progress toward the stapes (stapedial fixation) or anteriorly toward the cochlea leading to conductive, sensorineural, or mixed hearing loss. Several genes are associated with familial otosclerosis with varied clinical signs. [MESH: D010040]

efotraits.label: mononeuropathy
efotraits.description: Disease or trauma involving a single peripheral nerve in isolation, or out of proportion to evidence of diffuse peripheral nerve dysfunction. Mononeuropathy multiplex refers to a condition characterized by multiple isolated nerve injuries. Mononeuropathies may result from a wide variety of causes, including ischemia; traumatic injury; compression; connective tissue diseases; cumulative trauma disorders; and other conditions. [MESH: D020422]

efotraits.label: alcohol dependence
efotraits.description: Physical and psychological dependence on alcohol. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: retinal detachment
efotraits.description: An eye emergency condition which may lead to blindness if left untreated. It is characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium. Causes include trauma, advanced diabetes mellitus, high myopia, and choroid tumors. Symptoms include sudden appearance of floaters, sudden light flushes, and blurred vision. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: eating disorder
efotraits.description: A broad group of psychological disorders with abnormal eating behaviors leading to physiological effects from overeating or insufficient food intake. [NCIT: C89332]

efotraits.label: autism spectrum disorder
efotraits.description: A spectrum of developmental disorders that includes autism, and Asperger syndrome. Signs and symptoms include poor communication skills, defective social interactions, and repetitive behaviors. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: REM sleep behavior disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder characterized by episodes of vigorous and often violent motor activity during rem sleep (sleep, rem). The affected individual may inflict self injury or harm others, and is difficult to awaken from this condition. Episodes are usually followed by a vivid recollection of a dream that is consistent with the aggressive behavior. This condition primarily affects adult males. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p393) [MESH: D020187]

efotraits.label: Self-injurious behavior
efotraits.description: Self-aggression. | All of these actions can be impulsive, compulsive, or planned.

efotraits.label: neuroblastoma
efotraits.description: Neuroblastoma (NB) is the most common solid, extracranial childhood tumor. It is an aggressive pediatric cancer that originates from neural crest tissues of the sympathetic nervous system. [PMID: 32903387]

efotraits.label: macular degeneration
efotraits.description: Loss of vision in the central portion of the retina (macula), secondary to retinal degeneration. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: major depressive disorder
efotraits.description: An episode of depression lasting two or more weeks without an intervening episode of mania. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: mental or behavioural disorder
efotraits.description: A disease that has its basis in the disruption of mental process. [MONDO: patterns/basis_in_disruption_of_process]

efotraits.label: Ischemic stroke
efotraits.description: Acute ischemic stroke (AIS) is defined by the sudden loss of blood flow to an area of the brain with the resulting loss of neurologic function. It is caused by thrombosis or embolism that occludes a cerebral vessel supplying a specific area of the brain. During a vessel occlusion, there is a core area where damage to the brain is irreversible and an area of penumbra where the brain has lost function owing to decreased blood flow but is not irreversibly injured. [PMID: 32054610]

efotraits.label: intracerebral hemorrhage
efotraits.description: Bleeding into one or both cerebral hemispheres including the basal ganglia and the cerebral cortex. It is often associated with hypertension and craniocerebral trauma. [MESH: D002543]

efotraits.label: diabetic retinopathy
efotraits.description: A chronic, pathological complication associated with diabetes mellitus, where retinal damages are incurred due to microaneurysms in the vasculature of the retina, progressively leading to abnormal blood vessel growth, and swelling and leaking of fluid from blood vessels, resulting in vision loss or blindness. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: cerebrovascular disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder resulting from inadequate blood flow in the vessels that supply the brain. Representative examples include cerebrovascular ischemia, cerebral embolism, and cerebral infarction. [NCIT: C2938]

efotraits.label: stroke
efotraits.description: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event. [NCIT: C3390]

efotraits.label: vascular dementia
efotraits.description: A degenerative vascular disorder affecting the brain. It is caused by the blockage of the blood supply to the brain. It is manifested with decline of memory and cognitive functions. [NCIT: C34525]

efotraits.label: brain neoplasm
efotraits.description: A neoplasm (disease) that involves the brain. [MONDO: patterns/location]

efotraits.label: occlusion precerebral artery
efotraits.description: Occlusion of a precerebral artery.

efotraits.label: age-related macular degeneration
efotraits.description: Age-related loss of vision in the central portion of the retina (macula), secondary to retinal degeneration. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: insomnia
efotraits.description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty in falling asleep and/or remaining asleep. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: obstructive sleep apnea
efotraits.description: Cessation of air flow during sleep due to upper airway obstruction. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: narcolepsy-cataplexy syndrome
efotraits.description: A type of narcolepsy characterized by excessive day-time sleepiness associated with uncontrollable sleep urges and cataplexy (loss of muscle tone often triggered by pleasant emotions). [Orphanet: 2073]

efotraits.label: central nervous system cancer
efotraits.description: A malignant neoplasm involving the central nervous system

efotraits.label: bipolar I disorder
efotraits.description: A bipolar disorder that is characterized by at least one manic or mixed episode.

efotraits.label: myxedema
efotraits.description: A condition characterized by severe hypothyroidism that is caused by autoimmune thyroid gland disorders, surgical reduction of thyroid tissue, radiation exposure, and viral infections. Signs and symptoms include generalized fatigue, lethargy, increased body weight, pale, edematous and thickened skin, low blood pressure, constipation and cold intolerance. [NCIT: C34834]

efotraits.label: sarcoidosis
efotraits.description: Sarcoidosis is a multisystemic disorder of unknown cause characterized by the formation of immune granulomas in involved organs. [Orphanet: 797]

efotraits.label: Dupuytren Contracture
efotraits.description: A fibromatosis of the palmar fascia characterized by thickening and contracture of the fibrous bands on the palmar surfaces of the hand and fingers. It arises most commonly in men between the ages of 30 and 50.

efotraits.label: device complication
efotraits.description: Any problem arising from the use of a medical device. [ NCI ]

efotraits.label: skin disease
efotraits.description: Any deviation from the normal structure or function of the skin or subcutaneous tissue that is manifested by a characteristic set of symptoms and signs. [NCIT: C3371]

efotraits.label: cataract
efotraits.description: Partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes that decreases visual acuity and eventually results in blindness. Some cataracts appear in infancy or in childhood, but most develop in older individuals. (Sternberg Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.) [NCIT: C26713]

efotraits.label: dermatitis
efotraits.description: An inflammatory process affecting the skin. Signs include red rash, itching, and blister formation. Representative examples are contact dermatitis, atopic dermatitis, and seborrheic dermatitis. [NCIT: C2983]

efotraits.label: corneal dystrophy
efotraits.description: The term corneal dystrophy embraces a heterogeneous group of bilateral genetically determined non-inflammatory corneal diseases that are usually restricted to the cornea. The designation is imprecise but remains in vogue because of its clinical value. [Orphanet: 34533]

efotraits.label: substance-related disorder
efotraits.description: A category of psychiatric disorders which include disorders related to the taking of a drug of abuse (including alcohol, prescribed medications and recreational drugs). [NCIT: C92203]

efotraits.label: chronic primary adrenal insufficiency
efotraits.description: A chronic disorder of the adrenal cortex resulting in the inadequate production of glucocorticoid and mineralocorticoid hormones. [Orphanet: 101959]

efotraits.label: pelvic organ prolapse
efotraits.description: Abnormal descent of a pelvic organ resulting in the protrusion of the organ beyond its normal anatomical confines. Symptoms often include vaginal discomfort, dyspareunia; urinary stress incontinence; and fecal incontinence. [MESH: D056887]

efotraits.label: cellulitis
efotraits.description: Inflammation of the dermis and subcutaneous tissues caused by a bacterial infection. Symptoms include erythema, edema, and pain to the affected area. [NCIT: C26715]

efotraits.label: open-angle glaucoma
efotraits.description: Chronic outflow obstruction of the eye's drainage canals that can lead to increased internal eye pressure and optic nerve damage. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: bone fracture
efotraits.description: Breaks in bones. [MESH: D050723]

efotraits.label: joint disease
efotraits.description: Any disorder of the joints. [NCIT: C35760]

efotraits.label: emphysema
efotraits.description: A subcategory of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It occurs in people who smoke and suffer from chronic bronchitis. It is characterized by inflation of the alveoli, alveolar wall damage, and reduction in the number of alveoli, resulting in difficulty breathing. [NCIT: C3348]

efotraits.label: respiratory system disease
efotraits.description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the respiratory system. Representative examples include pneumonia, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, pulmonary failure, lung adenoma, lung carcinoma, and tracheal carcinoma. [NCIT: C26871]

efotraits.label: keratoconus
efotraits.description: A degenerative, structural disorder of the eye, characterized by a cone-shaped protrusion of the cornea. It may lead to visual disturbances. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: iritis
efotraits.description: Inflammation of the iris. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: prurigo nodularis
efotraits.description: Prurigonodularis (PN) is a skin disease in which hard crusty lumps are formed on the skin that itches intensely. Repetitive rubbing, scratching, and touching results in more lesions in the skin. The itching is so intense that people scratch themselves to the point of bleeding or pain. The lumps formed in the skin are hard, and have about a half inch across, with a dry and rough top that is often scratched open. They tend to be located in the areas most easily reached and are worse on the outer sides: arms, shoulders and legs. The trunk, face and even palms can also be affected. The exact cause is unknown but some factors triggering PN include liver and kidneys problems, nervous and mental conditions and other skin diseases. Prurigo nodulares, in some cases, can be seen in other diseases such as lymphoma, chronic autoimmune cholestatic hepatitis, HIV infection, severe anemia,or a chronic kidney disease-related itching known as uremic pruritus. Treatment is very difficult, and may include corticoids, antihistaminic and other medication such as thalidomide and similar (Lenalidomide). In some cases, cryotherapy, photochemotherapy and habit reversal therapy for the itch-scratch cycle has improved the symptoms. PN can last for many years, and the itching is so intense that may affect all the everyday activities. [GARD: 0007480]

efotraits.label: hematologic disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the hematopoietic system.

efotraits.label: connective tissue disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the connective tissue.

efotraits.label: endocrine system disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the endocrine system.

efotraits.label: prostate disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the prostate gland.

efotraits.label: acute kidney failure
efotraits.description: Sudden and sustained deterioration of the kidney function characterized by decreased glomerular filtration rate, increased serum creatinine or oliguria. [NCIT: C26808]

efotraits.label: chronic kidney disease
efotraits.description: Impairment of the renal function secondary to chronic kidney damage persisting for three or more months. [NCIT: C80078]

efotraits.label: nontoxic goiter
efotraits.description: Sporadic enlargement of the thyroid gland that is not associated with changes in thyroid function or malignancy. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: complication
efotraits.description: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure. [ NCI ]

efotraits.label: hyperthyroidism
efotraits.description: Overactivity of the thyroid gland resulting in overproduction of thyroid hormone and increased metabolic rate. Causes include diffuse hyperplasia of the thyroid gland (Graves' disease), single nodule in the thyroid gland, and thyroiditis. The symptoms are related to the increased metabolic rate and include weight loss, fatigue, heat intolerance, excessive sweating, diarrhea, tachycardia, insomnia, muscle weakness, and tremor. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: seborrheic keratosis
efotraits.description: A common benign skin neoplasm usually affecting older individuals. The lesions usually are multiple and arise in the face, chest, and shoulders. They appear as black or brown, slightly elevated skin lesions. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: diabetic eye disease
efotraits.description: A group of disorders affecting the eye in patients with diabetes mellitus. It includes cataract, glaucoma, retinopathy, and blindness. [ NCI ]

efotraits.label: childhood onset asthma
efotraits.description: Asthma that starts in childhood. [EFO: 0004591]

efotraits.label: endometriosis
efotraits.description: The growth of functional endometrial tissue in anatomic sites outside the uterine body. It most often occurs in the pelvic organs. [NCIT: C3014]

efotraits.label: hypothyroidism
efotraits.description: Abnormally low levels of thyroid hormone. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: disease
efotraits.description: A disease is a disposition to undergo pathological processes that exists in an organism because of one or more disorders in that organism. [OGMS: 0000031]

efotraits.label: interstitial lung disease
efotraits.description: A diverse group of lung diseases that affect the lung parenchyma. They are characterized by an initial inflammation of pulmonary alveoli that extends to the interstitium and beyond leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis. Interstitial lung diseases are classified by their etiology (known or unknown causes), and radiological-pathological features. [MESH: D017563]

efotraits.label: Nasal Cavity Polyp
efotraits.description: A soft and painless polypoid mass that arises from the mucosa in the nasal cavity. It is usually the result of an inflammatory process. It may recur following surgical resection. [NCIT: C3256]

efotraits.label: disorder of pilosebaceous unit
efotraits.description: A disease that involves the pilosebaceous unit. [MONDO: patterns/location]

efotraits.label: osteoarthritis, knee
efotraits.description: Noninflammatory degenerative disease of the knee joint consisting of three large categories: conditions that block normal synchronous movement, conditions that produce abnormal pathways of motion, and conditions that cause stress concentration resulting in changes to articular cartilage. (Crenshaw, Campbell's Operative Orthopaedics, 8th ed, p2019) [MESH: D020370]

efotraits.label: blood coagulation disease
efotraits.description: A condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal coagulation properties of the blood. [NCIT: C2902]

efotraits.label: benign prostatic hyperplasia
efotraits.description: A non-cancerous nodular enlargement of the prostate gland. It is characterized by the presence of epithelial cell nodules, and stromal nodules containing fibrous and smooth muscle elements. It is the most common urologic disorder in men, causing blockage of urine flow. [NCIT: C2897]

efotraits.label: Intervertebral Disc Displacement
efotraits.description: An INTERVERTEBRAL DISC in which the nucleus pulposus has protruded through surrounding fibrocartilage. This occurs most frequently in the lower lumbar region.

efotraits.label: urinary system disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the renal system.

efotraits.label: asthma
efotraits.description: A bronchial disease that is characterized by chronic inflammation and narrowing of the airways, which is caused by a combination of environmental and genetic factors resulting in recurring periods of wheezing (a whistling sound while breathing), chest tightness, shortness of breath, mucus production and coughing. The symptoms appear due to a variety of triggers such as allergens, irritants, respiratory infections, weather changes, exercise, stress, reflux disease, medications, foods and emotional anxiety. [EFO: 0000270]

efotraits.label: Epiphyses, Slipped
efotraits.description: One of the most common adolescent hip disorders and represents a unique type of instability of the proximal femoral growth plate. Four separate clinical groups are seen: Pre-slip (wide epiphyseal line without slippage), acute form (10-15% - slippage occurs suddenly, normally spontaneous), acute-on-chronic (slippage occurs acutely where there is already existing chronic slip) and chronic (85% - steadily progressive slippage, the most common form).

efotraits.label: Follicular Cyst
efotraits.description: Cyst due to the occlusion of the duct of a follicle or small gland.

efotraits.label: corneal disease
efotraits.description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the cornea. Representative examples include keratitis, bullous keratopathy, and squamous cell carcinoma. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
efotraits.description: A chronic and progressive lung disorder characterized by the loss of elasticity of the bronchial tree and the air sacs, destruction of the air sacs wall, thickening of the bronchial wall, and mucous accumulation in the bronchial tree. The pathologic changes result in the disruption of the air flow in the bronchial airways. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, wheezing, productive cough, and chest tightness. The two main types of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease are chronic obstructive bronchitis and emphysema. [NCIT: C3199]

efotraits.label: sunburn
efotraits.description: An inflammatory reaction from ultraviolet radiation characterized by transient redness, tenderness and occasional blistering. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: vertebral column disorder
efotraits.description: A disease involving the vertebral column. [MONDO: patterns/location_top]

efotraits.label: glaucoma
efotraits.description: Increased pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the outflow of aqueous humor. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: anemia
efotraits.description: A reduction in the number of red blood cells, the amount of hemoglobin, and/or the volume of packed red blood cells. Clinically, anemia represents a reduction in the oxygen-transporting capacity of a designated volume of blood, resulting from an imbalance between blood loss (through hemorrhage or hemolysis) and blood production. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability. [NCIT: C2869]

efotraits.label: osteoporosis
efotraits.description: A condition of reduced bone mass, with decreased cortical thickness and a decrease in the number and size of the trabeculae of cancellous bone (but normal chemical composition), resulting in increased fracture incidence. Osteoporosis is classified as primary (Type 1, postmenopausal osteoporosis; Type 2, age-associated osteoporosis; and idiopathic, which can affect juveniles, premenopausal women, and middle-aged men) and secondary osteoporosis (which results from an identifiable cause of bone mass loss). [NCIT: C3298]

efotraits.label: urolithiasis
efotraits.description: Stone(s) within the urinary tract. [NCIT: C114688]

efotraits.label: osteoarthritis, hip
efotraits.description: Noninflammatory degenerative disease of the hip joint which usually appears in late middle or old age. It is characterized by growth or maturational disturbances in the femoral neck and head, as well as acetabular dysplasia. A dominant symptom is pain on weight-bearing or motion. [MESH: D015207]

efotraits.label: multinodular goiter
efotraits.description: Nodular goiter characterized by more than one discrete tissue mass. [NCIT: C131438]

efotraits.label: upper extremity fracture
efotraits.description: A traumatic break in one or more of the bones in the arm, forearm, or hand. [ NCI ]

efotraits.label: spondylosis
efotraits.description: A degenerative spinal disease that can involve any part of the vertebra, the intervertebral disk, and the surrounding soft tissue. [MESH: D055009]

efotraits.label: skin sarcoidosis
efotraits.description: Formation of non-necrotizing granulomas in the skin. It may be a manifestation of systemic sarcoidosis or may also arise in isolation. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: congenital vitamin K-dependent coagulation factors deficiency
efotraits.description: Congenital vitamin K-dependent coagulation factors deficiency involving multiple coagulation factors.

efotraits.label: osteoarthritis
efotraits.description: A noninflammatory degenerative joint disease occurring chiefly in older persons, characterized by degeneration of the articular cartilage, hypertrophy of bone at the margins and changes in the synovial membrane. It is accompanied by pain and stiffness, particularly after prolonged activity. [NCIT: C3293]

efotraits.label: eye disease
efotraits.description: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the eye. Representative examples include conjunctivitis, glaucoma, cataract, conjunctival squamous cell carcinoma, uveal melanoma, and retinoblastoma. [NCIT: C26767]

efotraits.label: Herpes Zoster
efotraits.description: A common dermal and neurologic disorder caused by reactivation of the varicella-zoster virus that has remained dormant within dorsal root ganglia, often for decades, after the patient's initial exposure to the virus in the form of varicella (chickenpox). It is characterized by severe neuralgic pain along the distribution of the affected nerve and crops of clustered vesicles over the area. [NCIT: C71079]

efotraits.label: arthritis
efotraits.description: An inflammatory process affecting a joint. Causes include infection, autoimmune processes, degenerative processes, and trauma. Signs and symptoms may include swelling around the affected joint and pain. [NCIT: C2883]

efotraits.label: ureterolithiasis
efotraits.description: The presence of a calculus in the ureter of the kidney; this is most often composed of mineral salts and proteins. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: thyroid disease
efotraits.description: A disease involving the thyroid gland.

efotraits.label: COVID-19
efotraits.description: A disease caused by infection with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2. [MONDO: patterns/infectious_disease_by_agent]

efotraits.label: fibroblastic disorder
efotraits.description: A disorder that affects fibroblasts.

efotraits.label: testicular neoplasm
efotraits.description: Tumors or cancer of the TESTIS. Germ cell tumors ( GERMINOMA) of the testis constitute 95% of all testicular neoplasms.

efotraits.label: nephrotic syndrome
efotraits.description: A collection of symptoms that include severe edema, proteinuria, and hypoalbuminemia; it is indicative of renal dysfunction. [NCIT: C34845]

efotraits.label: kidney failure
efotraits.description: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: respiratory tract infectious disorder
efotraits.description: Invasion of the host RESPIRATORY SYSTEM by microorganisms, usually leading to pathological processes or diseases. [MESH: D012141]

efotraits.label: Rh isoimmunization
efotraits.description: The mother develops antibodies against red blood cell Rhesus antigens. This may lead to potential fetal adverse outcomes such as anemia. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: radius fracture
efotraits.description: Traumatic or pathological injury to the radius bone in which the continuity of the bone is broken. [EFO: 0003957]

efotraits.label: polymyalgia rheumatica
efotraits.description: A syndrome characterized by pain, stiffness, and tenderness of the proximal muscle groups including the shoulder, pelvic girdle and the neck. There is no muscle atrophy and muscle biopsies do not reveal pathologic changes. Additional signs and symptoms include low grade fever, fatigue and depression. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: nephrolithiasis
efotraits.description: The presence of a calculus in the pelvis of the kidney; this is most often composed of mineral salts and proteins. [NCIT: P378]

efotraits.label: soft tissue disease
efotraits.description: A disease affecting tissues that connect, support, or surround other structures and organs of the body, not being hard tissue such as bone. Soft tissue includes tendons, ligaments, fascia, skin, fibrous tissues, fat, and synovial membranes (which are connective tissue), and muscles, nerves and blood vessels (which are not connective tissue).

efotraits.label: insomnia measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of insomnia such as how often it occurs and its severity

efotraits.label: presubiculum volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a presubiculum. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: pallidum volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a pallidum. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: whole body water mass
efotraits.description: The weight of an individual's body water, i.e. the water content of a body that is contained in the tissues, the blood, the bones and elsewhere. The percentages of body water contained in various fluid compartments add up to total body water (TBW).

efotraits.label: liver fat measurement
efotraits.description: A quantification of the fat content of the liver such as liver fat fraction, typically assessed by MRI.

efotraits.label: lifestyle measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of a subject's lifestyle.

efotraits.label: alkaline phosphatase measurement
efotraits.description: Alkaline phosphatase measurement is a quantification of alkaline phosphatase in blood. AP is a marker for bone and liver disease.

efotraits.label: calcium measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of calcium, typically in serum. Calcium (Ca2+) plays a pivotal role in the physiology and biochemistry of organisms and the cell. It plays an important role in signal transduction pathways, where it acts as a second messenger, in neurotransmitter release from neurons, contraction of all muscle cell types, and fertilization. Many enzymes require calcium ions as a cofactor, those of the blood-clotting cascade being notable examples. Extracellular calcium is also important for maintaining the potential difference across excitable cell membranes, as well as proper bone formation.

efotraits.label: metabolic rate measurement
efotraits.description: a quantification of metabolic rate

efotraits.label: fourth ventricle volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a fourth ventricle. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: longitudinal alcohol consumption measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of alcohol consumption over a long period of time (typically several years)

efotraits.label: IGF-1 measurement
efotraits.description: Is the quantification of Insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1), also called somatomedin C. IGF-1 is a hormone similar in molecular structure to insulin. It plays an important role in childhood growth and continues to have anabolic effects in adults. Levels of IGF-1 are known to increase in some cancers.

efotraits.label: wellbeing measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of wellbeing such as life satisfaction or emotional wellbeing, usually self-reported and quantified through the use of a structured questionnaire

efotraits.label: worry measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of whether an individual feels or felt worried.

efotraits.label: hippocampal CA1 volume
efotraits.description: Volume of hippocampal CA1, which is the part of hippocampus proper bounded by CA2 and the subiculum, characterized by pyramidal neurons that receive projections from pyramidal neurons of CA3 via the Schaffer collaterals.

efotraits.label: proinsulin measurement
efotraits.description: Measurement of proinsulin, an insulin precursor that is processed into mature insulin and C-peptide.

efotraits.label: lean body mass
efotraits.description: The weight of all organs and tissue in an individual less the weight of the individual's body fat.

efotraits.label: platelet volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a platelet. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: age at death
efotraits.description: The age at which death occurs.

efotraits.label: emotional symptom measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of emotional problem symptoms, such as their existence and severity, usually via a standardised questionnaire such as the emotional symptoms subscale of the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire or interview with a qualified mental health professional

efotraits.label: hippocampus fimbria volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a hippocampus fimbria. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: insulin sensitivity measurement
efotraits.description: An insulin sensitivity measurement is a measurement of insulin metabolism, which can be measured in a number of ways, for example using the HOMA model or via a glucose tolerance test.

efotraits.label: age at menarche
efotraits.description: The age of onset of (human) menarche, the beginning of the first menstrual cycle in an individual

efotraits.label: anxiety measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of the level of a generalised feeling of anxiety experienced by an individual, typically measured via a questionnaire.

efotraits.label: trauma exposure measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of trauma exposure.

efotraits.label: insulin secretion trait
efotraits.description: The quality of a insulin secretion. [obo: oba/patterns/entity_attribute_part_of]

efotraits.label: sleep duration trait
efotraits.description: The duration of a sleep. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: serum gamma-glutamyl transferase measurement
efotraits.description: Serum gamma-glutamyl transferase level measurement is the quantification of gamma-glutamyl transferase in blood. Gamma-glutamyl transferase is used as a marker for liver/bile duct problems and alcohol abuse.

efotraits.label: loneliness measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of loneliness, such as severity or presence/absence, generally through administration of a standardised questionnaire such as the 3-Item Leave Behind Questionnaire (LBQ).

efotraits.label: insulin response measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of insulin response, typically measuring insulin levels in the blood following a glucose challenge

efotraits.label: merkel cell virus seropositivity
efotraits.description: The result of a measurement of circulating merkel cell virus-specific antibodies.

efotraits.label: thyroxine measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the thyroid hormone thyroxine (T4) in the blood, usually as an indicator of thyroid function

efotraits.label: vital capacity
efotraits.description: The volume of air that is exhaled by a maximal expiration following a maximal inspiration.

efotraits.label: family history of lung cancer
efotraits.description: A reported family history of lung cancer in one or more family members.

efotraits.label: father's age at death
efotraits.description: The age of a person's father at which father's death occurred.

efotraits.label: mosaic loss of chromosome Y measurement
NSAID use measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of NSAID use

efotraits.label: tea consumption measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some tea consumption or tea consumption-related behaviour, usually self-reported via a questionnaire.

efotraits.label: white matter volume measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the volume of white matter in the brain, usually through an MRI scan

efotraits.label: heart rate
efotraits.description: The rate of a heart contraction. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: white matter hyperintensity measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of white matter hyperintensity, usually measured by MRI

efotraits.label: heel bone mineral density
efotraits.description: Quantification of the mineral density of the heel bone

efotraits.label: age at diagnosis
efotraits.description: The age, measured from some defined time point e.g. birth at which a subject (e.g. a human patient) is diagnosed with some disease e.g. breast cancer.

efotraits.label: corneal resistance factor
efotraits.description: A measure of the biomechanical properties of the cornea. Low corneal resistance factor may be indicative of keratoconus.

efotraits.label: insulin use measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of the use of insulin.

efotraits.label: age at first birth measurement
efotraits.description: A measurement of the age at which a woman gave birth to her first live child

efotraits.label: waist circumference
efotraits.description: The circumference of a abdominal segment of trunk. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: hippocampal fissure volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a hippocampal sulcus. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: cognitive decline measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of cognitive decline such as the rate at which it occurs or its severity, for example in patients with dementia or Alzheimer's disease. Cognitive decline is ususally assessed using a structured-interview protocol covering a number of standardised areas.

efotraits.label: sodium measurement
efotraits.description: A quantitative measurement of the amount of sodium present in a sample.

efotraits.label: HOMA-B
efotraits.description: The HOMA-B measurement employs the homeostatic model assessment (HOMA)  to quantify beta-cell function.

efotraits.label: hip circumference
efotraits.description: The circumference of a hip. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: sitting height measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of height, when assuming a sitting position.

efotraits.label: hippocampal CA3 volume
efotraits.description: Volume of hippocampal CA3, which is the part of hippocampus proper bounded by the hilus of the dentate gyrus and area CA2, characterized by large pyramidal cells and a dense projection from dentate gyrus granule cell mossy fibers.

efotraits.label: hippocampal amigdala transition area volume
efotraits.description: Volume of hippocampal amigdala transition area.

efotraits.label: urinary albumin to creatinine ratio
efotraits.description: quantification of the ratio of albumin to creatinine in a urine sample

efotraits.label: sex hormone-binding globulin measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of sex hormone binding globulin. In men the test is used in when investigating testosterone deficiency.  The SHBG glycoprotein binds to circulating estradiol and testosterone, low levels of SHBG may be implicated in breast cancer etiology.

efotraits.label: hippocampal formation volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a hippocampal formation. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: tobacco smoke exposure measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of tobacco smoke exposure.

efotraits.label: neuroimaging measurement
efotraits.description: Non-invasive methods of visualizing and measuring the CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM, especially the brain, by various imaging modalities e.g. CT scan | is about MeSH:D059906

efotraits.label: strand of hair color
efotraits.description: The color of a strand of hair. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: blood protein measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the levels of some protein in a blood sample

efotraits.label: urinary microalbumin measurement
efotraits.description: The quantification of microalbumin in urine.

efotraits.label: velocity of sound measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the speed at which sound travels through bone as an indicator of the physical and structural properties of the bone

efotraits.label: body height
efotraits.description: The height of a multicellular organism. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: creatinine clearance measurement
efotraits.description: The clearance rate of creatinine, that is, the volume of plasma that is cleared of creatinine by the kidneys per unit time. Creatinine clearance is calculated using the level of creatinine in a sample of urine, usually one collected over a period of 24 hours, the corresponding plasma creatinine level, and the volume of urine excreted. It is used as an approximation of the glomerular filtration rate (GFR).

efotraits.label: BMI-adjusted fasting blood insulin measurement
efotraits.description: fasting insulin measurement that has been adjusted for subjects' body mass index

efotraits.label: smoking behavior trait
efotraits.description: The quality of a smoking behavior. [obo: oba/patterns/entity_attribute_part_of]

efotraits.label: brain stem volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a brainstem. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: anthropometric measurement
efotraits.description: Anthropometry is a measurement of the size, weight, and proportions of the human or other primate body.

efotraits.label: number of children ever born measurement
efotraits.description: A measurement of the number of children born

efotraits.label: coffee consumption measurement
efotraits.description: the quantification of some coffee consumption or coffee consumption-related behaviour, usually self-reported via a questionnaire

efotraits.label: social interaction measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification, typically by a questionnaire, of some aspect of social interaction, such as engagement in social activities,  or degree of contact with friends and family.

efotraits.label: Thyroid preparation use measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of the use of thyroid preparations.

efotraits.label: tiredness measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification an individual's level of tiredness, generally via a standardised questionnaire or structured interview.

efotraits.label: friendship satisfaction measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of friendship satisfaction.

efotraits.label: feeling emotionally hurt measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of whether an individual feels or felt emotionally hurt.

efotraits.label: forced expiratory volume
efotraits.description: Measure of the maximum amount of air that can be expelled in a given number of seconds during aÂ FORCED VITAL CAPACITYÂ determination . It is usually given asÂ FEVÂ followed by a subscript indicating the number of seconds over which the measurement is made, although it is sometimes given as a percentage of forced vital capacity.

efotraits.label: diet measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of diet, including diet patterns, balance of nutrient consumption and glycemic load

efotraits.label: bilirubin measurement
efotraits.description: A bilirubin measurement is a quantification of bilirubin typically measured in serum.

efotraits.label: dentate gyrus volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a gyrus. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: alcohol dependence measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of alcohol dependence or misuse, eg using a cummulative symptom score to determine the severity of a case of alcohol dependence

efotraits.label: drug use measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of drug use, such as whether drug use occured, over what period of time it occured and what dosage was used

efotraits.label: visual acuity measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of visual acuity

efotraits.label: glucose tolerance test
efotraits.description: A test to determine the ability of an individual to maintain homeostatis of blood glucose. It includes measuring blood glucose levels in a fasting state, and at prescribed intervals before and after oral glucose intake (75 or 100 g) or intravenous infusion (0.5 g/kg).

efotraits.label: vitamin supplement exposure measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of the consumption of dietry vitamin supplements.

efotraits.label: GFR change measurement
efotraits.description: A quantification of the variation in an individual's glomerular filtration rate (GFR) over a period of time used in assessment of kidney function and diagnosis of kidney disease.

efotraits.label: ferritin measurement
efotraits.description: A ferritin measurement a is measurement of ferritin level  in serum as an indicator of iron metabolism

efotraits.label: serum alanine aminotransferase measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of serum alanine aminotransferase, most commonly found in liver, the test is used in ascertainment of liver function.

efotraits.label: balding measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the amount of balding in an individual

efotraits.label: Varicella zoster virus seropositivity
efotraits.description: The result of a measurement of circulating Varicella zoster virus-specific antibodies

efotraits.label: glomerular filtration rate
efotraits.description: The rate of a glomerular filtration. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: urea measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of urea in a sample.

efotraits.label: bone density
efotraits.description: The mass density of a bone tissue. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: corneal hysteresis
efotraits.description: A measure of the biomechanical properties of the cornea. Low corneal hysteresis may be indicative of keratoconus.

efotraits.label: physical activity measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of physical activity such as frequency or intensity

efotraits.label: feeling nervous measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of whether an individual feels or felt nervous or "suffered from nerves".

efotraits.label: base metabolic rate measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of an individual's base metabolic rate, the minimum amount of energy required to sustain life while at complete rest, including the body being in a post-absorptive state (ie the digestive system is inactive). BMR differs from RMR because BMR measurements must meet total physiological equilibrium whereas RMR conditions of measurement can be altered and defined by the contextual limitations.

efotraits.label: HOMA-IR
efotraits.description: The HOMA-IR measurement employs the homeostatic model assessment (HOMA)  to quantify insulin resistance.

efotraits.label: aspartate aminotransferase measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of aspartate aminotransferase, and is commonly used as a marker for liver function.

efotraits.label: estradiol measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of circulating estradiol a circulating steriod sex hormone.

efotraits.label: caudate nucleus volume
efotraits.description: The volume of the caudate nucleus, a brain structure implicated in many common neurological and psychiatric disorders

efotraits.label: cigarettes per day measurement
efotraits.description: the quantification of the number of cigarettes that a subject smoked on average per day

efotraits.label: executive function measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of executive function in an individual, for example using the Behavioural Rating Inventory of Executive Function (BRIEF). Tests of executive function may be performed as part of a more comprehensive assessment to diagnose neurological and psychiatric disorders.

efotraits.label: reproductive behavior trait
efotraits.description: The quality of a reproductive behavior. [obo: oba/patterns/entity_attribute_part_of]

efotraits.label: vitamin B12 measurement
efotraits.description: is a quantification of Vitamin B12, vitamin B12 or vitamin B-12, is a water-solublevitamin with a key role in the normal functioning of the brain and nervous system, and for the formation of blood. It is one of the eight B vitamins. It is normally involved in themetabolism of every cell of the human body, especially affecting DNA synthesis and regulation, but also fatty acid synthesis and energy production. It is the largest and most structurally complicated vitamin and can be produced industrially only through bacterial fermentation-synthesis.

efotraits.label: alcohol consumption quality
efotraits.description: The quality of a alcohol consumption. [obo: oba/patterns/entity_attribute_part_of]

efotraits.label: family history of Alzheimer’s disease
efotraits.description: A reported family history of Alzheimer’s disease in one or more family members.

efotraits.label: glucose measurement
efotraits.description: Is any quantification of glucose.

efotraits.label: urate measurement
efotraits.description: A urate measurement is the quantification of some urate in body fluid

efotraits.label: carbohydrate intake measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of the carbohydrate intake of an individual.

efotraits.label: superior frontal gyrus grey matter volume measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the volume of grey matter in the superior frontal gyrus, usuallly through an MRI scan

efotraits.label: cystatin C measurement
efotraits.description: is a quantification of serum cystatin C C (formerly gamma trace, post-gamma-globulin or neuroendocrine basic polypeptide),[1] a protein encoded by the CST3 gene, is mainly used as a biomarker of kidney function and kidney disease.

efotraits.label: erythrocyte volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a erythrocyte. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: urinary metabolite measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some metabolite in urine

efotraits.label: gestational age
efotraits.description: The age of the conceptus, beginning from the time of FERTILIZATION. In clinical obstetrics, the gestational age is often estimated as the time from the last day of the last MENSTRUATION which is about 2 weeks before OVULATION and fertilization.

efotraits.label: health satisfaction measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of health satisfaction.

efotraits.label: phosphate measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of phosphate levels in a sample.

efotraits.label: snoring measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of snoring such as frequency or severity

efotraits.label: subiculum volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a subiculum. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: age at first sexual intercourse measurement
efotraits.description: A measurement of the age at which a person has the first sexual intercourse.

efotraits.label: grip strength measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the force applied by the hand to pull on or suspend from objects

efotraits.label: bone quantitative ultrasound measurement
efotraits.description: A bone quantitative ultrasound measurement is the output of a an ultrasound process in which bones are assayed using ultrasound and information about bone density, cortical thickness, elasticity and microarchitecture may be returned.

efotraits.label: intraocular pressure measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of intraocular pressure. Increased intraocular pressure is a heritable risk factor for primary open angle glaucoma.

efotraits.label: depressive symptom measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the existence and severity of depressive symptoms, usually via a questionnaire such as the Center for Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale (CES-D)

efotraits.label: hippocampal volume
efotraits.description: Measurement of the volume of the hippocampus

efotraits.label: QRS duration
efotraits.description: See also EFO_0005054

efotraits.label: peak expiratory flow
efotraits.description: The maximum rate of gas flow, beginning at the point of peak inspiratory capacity, that can be sustained during forced exhalation for a defined period of time. | The maximum rate of gas flow, beginning at the point of peak inspiratory capacity, that can be sustained during forced exhalation for a defined period of time. This test is most often used in combination with other studies of lung function to diagnose and monitor obstructive and restrictive lung disease(s). [ NCI ]

efotraits.label: life span trait
efotraits.description: The quality of a life cycle. [obo: oba/patterns/entity_attribute_part_of]

efotraits.label: menstrual cycle attribute
efotraits.description: The quality of a menstrual cycle. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: polyomavirus 2 seropositivity
efotraits.description: The result of a measurement of circulating polyomavirus 2-specific antibodies.

efotraits.label: carotid artery thickness
efotraits.description: The thickness of a carotid artery segment. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: smoking status measurement
efotraits.description: self-reported binary measure, used to denote whether an individual is currently or has ever been a smoker

efotraits.label: health-related quality of life measurement
efotraits.description: A measure to assess health-related quality of life (HRQOL), which domains include physical health, emotional health, cognitive functioning, fatigue and pain.

efotraits.label: eye measurement
efotraits.description: Is a quantification of some eye structure or property of an eye structure, such as corneal thickness.

efotraits.label: hippocampus molecular layer volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a hippocampus molecular layer. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: aging rate
efotraits.description: The rate of the aging process.

efotraits.label: aspartate aminotransferase to alanine aminotransferase ratio
efotraits.description: The ratio between the levels of aspartate aminotransferase (AST) and alanine aminotransferase (ALT).

efotraits.label: BMI-adjusted fasting blood glucose measurement
efotraits.description: fasting blood glucose measurement that has been adjusted for subjects' body mass index

efotraits.label: grey matter volume measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of the volume of grey matter in the brain, usuallly through an MRI scan. Grey matter volume is associated with schizophrenia.

efotraits.label: neuroticism measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of neuroticism or neurotic behaviour, such as severity or frequency of neurotic behaviour. This is usually assessed via a standardised questionnaire.

efotraits.label: depressive episode measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect, eg frequency or severity, of depressive episodes in patients with mental or behavioural disorders such as bipolar disorder or clinical depression

efotraits.label: fat pad mass
efotraits.description: The mass of a fat pad. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: nicotine metabolite ratio
efotraits.description: quantification of the ratio of 3’-trans-hydroxycotinine to cotinine in a sample, typically in a urine or blood sample

efotraits.label: hippocampal CA4 volume
efotraits.description: Volume of hippocampal CA4.

efotraits.label: thalamus volume
efotraits.description: quantification of the volume of the thalamus, a midline symmetrical structure of two halves, within the vertebrate brain, situated between the cerebral cortex and the midbrain

efotraits.label: non-alcoholic fatty liver disease severity measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of the severity of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, typically by a histological grading.

efotraits.label: parasubiculum volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a parasubiculum. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: behavioural disinhibition measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of behavioural disinhibition, including risky and impulsive behaviours. Behavioural disinhibition can be a marker for certain kinds of mental or behavioural disorders.

efotraits.label: age at initiation of smoking
efotraits.description: Age of initation of the habit of smoking, the inhaling and exhaling of tobacco smoke.

efotraits.label: rheumatoid factor measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of rheumatoid factors, antibodies in the serum of individuals with rheumatoid arthritis that react with antigenic determinants or immunoglobulins that enhance agglutination of suspended particles coated with pooled human gamma -globulin. Rheumatoid factors also occur in other autoimmune and certain infectious diseases.

efotraits.label: educational attainment
efotraits.description: A measure of academic performance through educational benchmarks such as national exams and curriculum assessments.

efotraits.label: nucleus accumbens volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a nucleus accumbens. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: beta-amyloid 1-42 measurement
efotraits.description: Is the quantification of Beta-amyloid 1-42 in cerebrospinal fluid typically used as a biomarker for Alzheimer's Disease

efotraits.label: aspirin use measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of aspirin use

efotraits.label: cerebrospinal fluid amount
efotraits.description: The volume of a cerebrospinal fluid. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: brain volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a brain. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: time spent outdoors measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of time an individual spends outside.

efotraits.label: Epstein Barr virus nuclear antigen-1 seropositivity
efotraits.description: The result of a measurement of circulating Epstein Barr virus nuclear antigen-1 antibodies used in the diagnosis of latent Epstein-Barr virus infection

efotraits.label: sun exposure measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some aspect of exposure to incident light from the sun.

efotraits.label: folic acid measurement
efotraits.description: A measurement of the folic acid in a biological sample

efotraits.label: APOE carrier status
efotraits.description: quantification of the presence or absence of apolipoprotein E (APOE) in an individual

efotraits.label: chronotype measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of chronotype such as ease of getting up in the morning

efotraits.label: creatine measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of creatine levels in a sample.

efotraits.label: putamen volume
efotraits.description: The volume of a putamen. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: refractive error measurement
efotraits.description: quantification of some aspect of refractive errors, which occur when the shape of the eye prevents light from focusing directly on the retina. The length of the eyeball (longer or shorter), changes in the shape of the cornea, or aging of the lens can cause refractive errors. Quantification of an individual's refractive error allows the establishemnt of a number of corrective parameters such as spherical equivalent, lens decentration and transposition

efotraits.label: fish consumption measurement
efotraits.description: Quantification of some fish consumption or fish consumption-related behaviour, usually self-reported via a questionnaire.

efotraits.label: age at menopause
efotraits.description: The age of onset of (human) menopause, the beginning of the first menstrual cycle in an individual

efotraits.label: bowel opening frequency
efotraits.description: The frequency of a defecation rhythm. [AUTO: patterns/patterns/entity_attribute]

efotraits.label: health trait
efotraits.description: The characteristics in health that a certain person has.

efotraits.label: number of treatments or medications taken, self-reported
efotraits.description: Number of treatments undergone by an individual (including medications taken), as reported by the individual.

efotraits.label: encounter with health service
